 DISALLOW_COPY_AND_ASSIGN (AudioStreamIn)

Detailed Description

The AudioStreamIn class manages the audio resources for applications to record audio from the audio input hardware of the platform.

The following example demonstrates how to use the AudioStreamIn. 

 MyPage::onInit(Persistence* const savedInstanceState) {

       //Initial argument of getFitBufferSize function.
       int32_t sampleRateHz = 44100;
       int32_t channel = AudioControl::CHANNEL_CONFIGURATION_MONO;
       int32_t audioFormat = AudioControl::ENCODING_PCM_16BIT;

     // Increase the ringer volume.
     int32_t recBufSize = AudioStreamIn::getFitBufferSize(sampleRateHz,
               channel, audioFormat);

     // New a AudioStreamIn instance.
       AudioStreamIn *mpAudioStreamIn = new AudioStreamIn(MediaRecorder::AUDIOSOURCE_MIC, sampleRateHz,
               channel, audioFormat, recBufSize);

       // Create a buffer array for recording the streaming.
     Array<int16_t> buffer(recBufSize);

     // Starts recording from the AudioStreamIn instance.
     mpAudioStreamIn->startGetStreaming();

       // Reads audio data from the audio hardware for recording into a buffer.
       int32_t bufferReadResult = getStreamingBuffer(buffer,0,recBufSize);

     // Stops recording.
     mpAudioStreamIn->stopGetStreaming();

 }

Member Enumeration Documentation

enum gaia::media::AudioStreamIn::InitialState

The inital status of AudioStreamIn.

Enumerator:
STATE_UNINITIALIZED 

State of an AudioStreamIn that was not successfully initialized upon creation.

STATE_INITIALIZED 

State of an AudioStreamIn that is ready to be used.

enum gaia::media::AudioStreamIn::PlayState

The play status of AudioStreamIn.

Enumerator:
RECORDSTATE_STOPPED 

indicates AudioStreamIn state is stopped

RECORDSTATE_RECORDING 

indicates AudioStreamIn state is recording

Constructor & Destructor Documentation

gaia::media::AudioStreamIn::AudioStreamIn ( MediaRecorder::AudioSource  audioSource,
int32_t  sampleRateInHz,
AudioControl::ChannelValue  channelConfig,
AudioControl::EncodingType  audioFormat,
int32_t  bufferSizeInBytes 
)

Class construct, use this constructor when the AudioStreamIn is needed to record raw audio data and set the stream input format.

Parameters:
audioSourcethe recording source. See MediaRecorder#AudioSource for recording source definitions.
sampleRateInHzthe sample rate expressed in Hertz. 44100Hz is currently the only rate that is guaranteed to work on all devices, but other rates such as 22050, 16000, and 11025 may work on some devices.
channelConfigdescribes the configuration of the audio channels. See AudioControl#CHANNEL_IN_MONO and AudioControl#CHANNEL_IN_STEREO. AudioControl#CHANNEL_IN_MONO is guaranteed to work on all devices.
audioFormatthe format in which the audio data is represented. See AudioControl#ENCODING_PCM_16BIT and AudioControl#ENCODING_PCM_8BIT
bufferSizeInBytesthe total size (in bytes) of the buffer where audio data is written to during the recording. New audio data can be read from this buffer in smaller chunks than this size. See getFitBufferSize(int, int, int) to determine the minimum required buffer size for the successful creation of an AudioStreamIn instance. Using values smaller than getFitBufferSize() will result in an initialization failure.
virtual gaia::media::AudioStreamIn::~AudioStreamIn ( ) [virtual]

Class disconstruct, use this disconstructor when the AudioStreamIn want to release it's resource.

static int32_t gaia::media::AudioStreamIn::getFitBufferSize ( int32_t  sampleRateHz,
int32_t  channel,
int32_t  audioFormat 
) [static]

Returns the minimum buffer size required for creating a new straming out track according to given samplerate, channel and format.

This buffer size is suggested value for you to fill in the buffer which you wants to play.

Parameters:
sampleRateHzthe sample rate expressed in Hertz. For example set 44100, 48000
channeldescribes the audio channels which you want to set Select 0 for MONO output Select 1 for STEREO output
audioFormatthe format which audio PCM data you want ot set Select 0 for PCM 8 BIT Select 1 for PCM 16 BIT
